intro: Boechera platysperma, commonly known as the broad-seeded rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. This perennial plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in mountainous regions. Its small, white or yellowish flowers bloom in early spring, and it produces distinctive, broad, flat seed pods. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
